description.value:
You concentrate on healing others with alchemy. You start with the formulas for two of the following in your formula book, in addition to your other formulas: @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Antidote (Lesser)]{Antidote (Lesser)}, @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Antiplague (Lesser)]{Antiplague (Lesser)}, or @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Elixir of Life (Minor)]{Elixir of Life (Minor)}.

Your research field adds a number of formulas to your formula book; these are your signature items. When using a batch of @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Infused Reagents]{Infused Reagents} to create your signature items using @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Advanced Alchemy]{Advanced Alchemy}, you create three items instead of two. Each time you gain a level, you can swap one of your signature items with another formula in your formula book. This new signature item must be on your research field's list of possible signature items.

As long as your proficiency rank in Medicine is trained or better, you can attempt a Crafting check instead of a Medicine check for any of Medicine's untrained and trained uses.

@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Field Discovery (Chirurgeon)]{Field Discovery}Level 5

When using Advanced Alchemy to make elixirs of life during your daily preparations, you can create three elixirs with each batch of reagents instead of two.

@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Perpetual Infusions (Chirurgeon)]{Perpetual Infusions}Level 7

You have learned how to create perpetual alchemical infusions that can provide a near-infinite supply of certain simple items. You gain the ability to create two 1st-level alchemical items using @Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Quick Alchemy]{Quick Alchemy} without spending a batch of infused reagents. The items you can select depend on your research field and must be in your formula book.

Lesser antidote and lesser antiplague.

@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Perpetual Potency (Chirurgeon)]{Perpetual Potency}Level 11

Your perpetual infusions improve, allowing you to use Quick Alchemy to create more powerful items with no cost. The items you can select depend on your research field and must be in your formula book.

Moderate @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Antidote (Moderate)]{Antidote} and @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Antiplague (Moderate)]{Antiplague}.

@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Greater Field Discovery (Chirurgeon)]{Greater Field Discovery}Level 13

When you use Quick Alchemy to create any type of elixir of life, the creature drinking the elixir gains the maximum Hit Points possible for that elixir, instead of rolling to determine the number of Hit Points regained.

@Compendium[pf2e.classfeatures.Perpetual Perfection (Chirurgeon)]{Perpetual Perfection}Level 17

You have perfected your perpetual infusions, allowing you to use Quick Alchemy to create even more powerful items at no cost. The items you can select depend on your research field and must be in your formula book.

Greater @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Antidote (Greater)]{Antidote} and @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Antiplague (Greater)]{Antiplague}.
